ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would summarize Latin 430 as a good Latin course that focuses on a surprisingly interesting yet uncommonly taught work. Professor Freudenburg's great knowledge of the subject and his laid-back personality made the class an interesting and unstressful one.
I would definitely recommend the Fasti, and Professor Freudenburg in general. The class was manageable and enjoyable.
Fun class with a great professor -- pretty slow pace, since it's a class that appeals to a wide range of Latinists. Still interesting and worthwhile, just expect to be on your own for a lot of it.

I would recommend this class. It's a straight forward L5 latin class. About 300 lines of translation every week, but Ovid is pretty easy to read. There's a quiz every week, but it keeps you on top of the translation. The fasti are pretty interesting... there's a lot of mythical background used to explain roman festivals and traditions. I liked the concept for the paper, which had us explore a very specific feature of the fasti of our choice in detail. The exams were perfectly fair and even a little bit easy.

Relatively easy class (120 lines translated per class, about), really chill professor, awesome subject matter. Quiz once a week (fairly easy, all material covered the previous week), one paper and a presentation about the paper, and a midterm and final.

An excellent translation-based course for someone with a solid background in Latin. Faster-paced than the high school Latin courses I took, but nothing unmanageable. Excellently taught, and very rewarding.
Highly recommended - focuses on a piece of literature that does not get the attention it deserves.

Coming into this from 4s on the latin AP tests was a very difficult step up. Maybe stick to something easier if that is your position. Otherwise, the course was interesting and probably pretty easy for more experienced students.
